data.name: Ring container
data.description:
### Task
Create a class that has an internal sequence container initialized upon construction. 
The class should have a ```next()``` function that returns a (shallow) copy of the element of the container to which the internal ring pointer points to, and moves the pointer one step. So, the subsequent function call to it should return the next element, and the call thereafter the following one, and so on. 
When the pointer reaches the end of the container, it should return to the first element, and proceed from there.
The first call to ```next()``` after the constuction should return the first element.
The class should throw an error when constructed with a 0 sized container.
The container is not modifiable after construction.
### Examples
If a container has one element, every call to ```next()``` returns a copy of the element.
If the container has the elements ```{1, 2, 3}```, the return values look like this:
```
1st call: 1
2nd call: 2
3rd call: 3
4th call: 1
```
### Constraints
The container type can be any of the sequence containers: vector, list, deque, forward_list and array.
The underlying type can be any integral or user-defined type.
